page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY - BUILDINGS
page.content: {Cam Mills}is the only woollen mill still working today. Owned by the Phillimore family it was first recorded in 1522. {Cam Hopton School}is one of the oldest Primary schools in Gloucestershire, founded in 1730 by a Miss Hopton. {Winterbotham Village Hall}was given by a cloth mill owner to Cam Mills workers. {Dursley Parish Church}of St. James the Great was built in the 14th and 15th Century. {Upper Knapp Farm}was first built in 1351. Charles 11 hid in a secret chamber after the battle of Worcester 1651. {Melksham Court}at Stinchcombe is said to have been the home of William Tyndale who was put to death in 1536 for translating the Bible into English
